meanings.definition: Relating to the movement of a fluid under the influence of an electric field.
meanings.sent1: The electroosmotic force helped the liquid move swiftly.
meanings.sent2: The lab experiment demonstrated the electroosmotic properties of the solution.
meanings.sent3: The electroosmotic effect made the water dance in the test tube.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like an electroosmotic current, flowing through the room.
meanings.sent5: The electroosmotic motion was as powerful as a lightning strike.

meanings.definition: The process of moving a fluid through a porous material by applying an electric field.
meanings.sent1: The scientist explained the electroosmotic process in simple terms.
meanings.sent2: The device utilized electroosmotic flow to filter the liquid efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen sponge seemed to exhibit electroosmotic behavior when wet.
meanings.sent4: The electroosmotic movement through the membrane was like a secret passage.
meanings.sent5: The electroosmotic phenomenon was as fascinating as a magic trick.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of fluid flow induced by an electric field.
meanings.sent1: The students observed the electroosmotic effect in the science experiment.
meanings.sent2: The researchers studied the electroosmotic phenomenon in detail.
meanings.sent3: The electroosmotic occurrence in the beaker surprised the class.
meanings.sent4: The electroosmotic flow resembled a gentle breeze in the lab.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of electroosmotic movement was like a graceful dance.
